title: Nal'ibali Web Resource Tree
description: Nal'ibali (isiXhosa for "here's the story") is a national reading-for-enjoyment campaign to spark children's potential through storytelling and reading.

children.title: Multilingual stories
children.description: Looking for stories to read in a range of African languages and English? Try our growing collection of stories to print out or read aloud.

children.title: The best street in the world
How the ostrich got a long neck
Neo and the big, wide world
The lark and the pomegranate tree
The old woman and her pig
The guinea fowl that laid golden eggs
The amazing tale of floating Zimkhitha
A gold star and kiss for Thoko
Die beste straat in die wêreld
Hoe die volstruis ’n lang nek gekry het
Neo en die grote, wye wêreld
Die ou vrou en haar vark
Die tarentaal wat goue eiers gelê het
Die verstommende verhaal van swewende Zimkhitha
Dit het alles met ’n babahondjie begin
Die leeu en die apie: ŉ storie uit Nigerië
ŉ Goue ster en ŉ soentjie vir Thoko
Indlela eyayifumana ngayo inciniba intamo yayo ende
Neo and the big, wide world
Letsatsi le bodutu la Abuti Mmutla
Hobaneng ha ditshwene di dula difateng
Motswalle wa nnete, wa hlooho ya kgomo
Jeresi ya Koketso eo a e ratang
Kamoo mpshe e neng e fumane molala o molelele ka teng
Sepoko ka hara dipijama tsa Nkgono
Leteketifi Gus, eo e leng korela
Neo le lefatshe le leholo, le batsi
Motswalle wa Thoko wa hlooho ya kgomo
Mpho ya Ntate bakeng sa letsatsi la tswalo
Kgaka e neng e behela mahe a kgauta
Pale e makatsang ya Zimkhitha ya fofang
Kamoo dipale di neng di qale ka teng
Borashe ba ho taka ba mehlolo
Letsatsi la tswalo le lebe ka ho fetisisa
Mong Mmutla o kopana le Mong Mandela
Thoko o fuwa naledi ya kgauta o bile o a sunwa
Letšatši la Buti Mmutla la bodutu
Motho yo mongwe le yo mongwe o kgethegile
Lebaka la go dira gore dikgabo di dule mehlareng
Ka fao mpšhe e hweditšego molala o motelele ka gona
Korila ya go bitšwa Gus ya Letseka
Dieta tša Koketso tša go ya moletlwaneng
Neo le lefase le legolo, le lephara
Mpho ya letšatši la matswalo la Tate
Sopo ya go kgethega ya Thoko
Kgaka yeo e beetšego mae a gauta
Nonwane ya go makatša ya Zimkhitha wa go phaphamala
Malusi le Ntatauwane ya ka Pafong
Ka fao dikanegelo di thomilego ka gona
Poraše ya go penta ya mehlolo
Moroki wa go bolawa ke bodutu
Thoko o hwetša naledi ya gauta ebile o a atlwa
Nganetshelo i mangadzaho ya Zimkhitha wa u fhefheḓa muyani
Nḓila ye zwiṱori zwa thoma ngayo
Neo le lefatshe le legolo, le le sephara
Leinane le le makatsang la ga Zimkhitha yo o kokobetseng
Neo na Misava leyikulu, yo anama
Ntsheketo wo hlamarisa wo phaphamala ka Zimkhitha
Audio stories
children.description: Browse our archive of audio stories in partnership with SABC Education to enjoy at home, at school or in your reading club.

children.title: I am an African
children.author: Nal'ibali
children.description: This beautiful poem, 'I am an African', is written and performed by our Story Bosso runner up - 11-year-old Millicent Motloutsi.

children.title: The best sound in the world - Read by Buhle Ngaba
children.author: Nal'ibali
children.description: Nal'ibali's 2017 World Read Aloud Day story, 'The best sound in the world', is about little Bella and her adventures with interesting sounds! Read by celebrity author and actress, Buhle Ngaba, this story captures the magic of sounds, love and family!

children.title: uSicabucabu umshayi wogubhu
children.author: Nal'ibali
children.description: This is the story of 'Spider the drummer' - Nal'ibali's WINNING story for Story Bosso 2016, by Nonhlanhla Hadebe from Gauteng!

children.title: Story cards
children.description: Grow your children's love of reading by printing out our beautifully illustrated story cards containing traditional and modern stories.

children.title: The Feast
children.description: Papa Smuts was a fisherman. But, fish were not as plentiful as they used to be and some days he came home empty handed. But somehow, him, Mama Smuts and their children always made the tastiest meals with their freshly grown vegetables. One evening, the Smuts family had the most delicious meal they've ever tasted, but for the strangest reason...
children.author: Jude Daly

children.title: Tselane and the giant
children.description: A long time ago, a poor woman lived with her daughter, Tselane, in a little house. One day, a giants heard Tselane’s mother singing to her to open the door. Tselane looked like a scrumptious meal to him, and the giant came up with a plan to get her to open the door…

children.title: Joseph’s cradle
children.description: When an old yellowwood tree was blown over by the wind, Joseph carved a little cradle out of its wood for his daughter. Soon, every new-born child in the village would be rocked in the cradle, creating a village tradition. Until one day, a veld fire threatened to change

children.title: Neo and the big, wide world
children.description: Neo looked out the window of his room at the grey view of the grey street with all the wet, grey people hurrying through the grey, pouring rain. He couldn’t go outside, and he had already read all his books to Mbali.
children.author: Vianne Venter

children.title: Sisanda’s gift
children.description: Every day when eight-year-old Sisanda gets home from school, she changes out of her uniform, eats her lunch and plays a game of umlabalaba with her grandfather. They have so much fun flying their “cows” around the board that she doesn’t want to stop.
children.author: Gcina Mhloph

children.title: Lion meets his match
children.description: After Lion and Little Jackal went hunting together, Little Jackal cunningly tricks Lion and gets all of the meat. Ever since that day, Lion made it his mission to catch the Little Jackal, except Jackal was much sneakier than he thought!
children.author: Retold by Joanne Bloch

children.title: The king of the birds
children.description: The birds can’t agree who should be their king, so they decide to have a competition to see who can fly the highest. At the agreed moment, all the birds fly up into the sky. Soon it looks like Nkwazi, the great fish eagle, is bound to win, but little Ncede the Neddicky bird cheated to take the title! When Ncede returns to the ground, he gets a very different reception than the one he imagined!
children.author: Retold by Joanne Bloch

children.title: Sisanda’s gift
children.description: Every day when eight-year-old Sisanda gets home from school, she changes out of her uniform, eats her lunch and plays a game of umlabalaba with her grandfather. They have so much fun flying their “cows” around the board that she doesn’t want to stop.
children.author: Gcina Mhloph

children.title: Neo and the big, wide world
children.description: Neo looked out the window of his room at the grey view of the grey street with all the wet, grey people hurrying through the grey, pouring rain. He couldn’t go outside, and he had already read all his books to Mbali.
children.author: Vianne Venter

children.title: Story seeds
children.description: Do you want to tell your own stories but sometimes find it a bit difficult to get going? Here are some ideas to get you started - available in 6 SA languages.

children.title: Setaele sa moriri wa Thandi se seswa
Your stories
children.description: Want to submit your own stories? Check out our selection of poems, stories and writings created by you - or send us your own here!

children.title: I am special because I am me!
I like the way I am
If all the world were paper: Translated
My Family Story: Do not cast the trusted ones away for new untested ones
